title: 6+ Reasons Your Ears Are Ringing (According to Legend)

steps.title: Ear ringing usually signals someone is talking about you.
steps.content: Ear ringing usually signals someone is talking about you. Technically, ear ringing means you’re in someone’s thoughts, but the other person is likely expressing their opinion about you to someone else. Their words can be positive or negative, but one thing's for sure: according to legend, you're on someone's mind. [1] X Research source Most people interpret ear ringing as someone gossiping negatively about them. According to urban legend, you can silence the speaker by wetting your finger with saliva and pressing it against your ear lobe. [2] X Research source There are also tons of medical reasons that your ears could be ringing: tinnitus, hearing loss, or high blood pressure. We'll cover those at the end of the article. Share what you think the ringing in your ear means on wikiHow's "Is there a spiritual meaning to my right ear ringing?" forum !

steps.title: You may experience a spiritual awakening soon.
steps.content: You may experience a spiritual awakening soon. If you hear ringing in either ear, it’s often a sign that you’re entering spiritual ascension. You’ve reached a higher frequency, bringing you closer to the divine, and you may have found your purpose in life . [3] X Research source Many people experience ringing in the ear during a Kundalini awakening . As your chakras open, you’re releasing negative energy and absorbing more powerful frequencies. [4] X Research source

steps.title: You can expect good fortune.
steps.content: You can expect good fortune. If you experience a high pitched ringing in the right ear, it might be a sign of prosperity in the near future. The Universe is rewarding you for all the hardships you endured the last few months, so prepare to celebrate yourself. [5] X Research source Even if you receive a considerable amount of money, continue to be frugal and live within your means.

steps.title: Someone who passed might be trying to speak to you.
steps.content: Someone who passed might be trying to speak to you. Have you lost a loved one recently? Ringing in the ear sometimes represents communication between the soul and higher spiritual beings, so it may be a sign that they’re trying to connect with you and let you know they’re okay. [6] X Research source If you’re in mourning , take comfort in knowing your loved one is still with you in spirit, and acknowledge your emotions. Everyone grieves differently, and each experience is perfectly valid.

steps.title: Your guardian angels might be trying to warn you.
steps.content: Your guardian angels might be trying to warn you. Low pitched ringing in the left ear could be a message to follow your intuition , especially if you’re making a difficult decision . Your guardian angels are here to protect you, so try to remain calm. Nervous or bad energy may be their way of preventing you from making a harmful decision. [7] X Research source If you’re stuck making a decision, reflect on your choices and consider the pros and cons of each option. Visualize that you’ve already made the decision to determine if it’s worth it.

steps.title: The Universe might be encouraging you to cut off toxic relationships.
steps.content: The Universe might be encouraging you to cut off toxic relationships. Many people interpret ear ringing as a wake-up call from the Universe: observe how others make you feel, and pay attention to their behavior. Are they judgemental, unsupportive, or confusing? Do you feel like you’re walking on eggshells around them? If so, you’re likely in a toxic relationship, so cut ties to restore your peace of mind. [8] X Research source When ending a toxic relationship , make sure you have support and let someone else know.

steps.title: 11PM-1AM
steps.content: 11PM-1AM If you hear ringing in your left ear around the stroke of midnight, it might be a sign that a loved one is thinking about you. [9] X Research source If you hear ringing in the right ear, you may want to assess your spending habits –it's a sign that you will lose money in the future.

steps.title: 1AM-3AM
steps.content: 1AM-3AM Ringing in the left ear sometimes predicts an argument or physical brawl. If you end up engaging in conflict, be sure to gain control of your emotions before acting rashly. [10] X Research source If you hear ringing in the right ear, the angels might be warning you of a more serious dispute.

steps.title: 3AM-5AM
steps.content: 3AM-5AM If your ear is ringing on the left side, you might lose some money, so adjust your lifestyle habits now to avoid financial hardship in the future. [11] X Research source Many people believe ear ringing is a sign of a busy schedule–prepare to be rushed off your feet.

steps.title: 5AM-7AM
steps.content: 5AM-7AM Ringing in the left ear might be a sign that you will enjoy an extravagant feast. [12] X Research source If you hear ringing in the right ear, prepare yourself for an unexpected visit from a friend.

steps.title: 7AM-9AM
steps.content: 7AM-9AM If your left ear rings during the morning, it might mean you’re about to embark on a journey. Whether it's a spiritual awakening or an actual road trip, prepare your mind for an exciting change and clear your schedule if possible. [13] X Research source If your right ear rings, it usually signals a friend is headed your way.

steps.title: 9AM-11AM
steps.content: 9AM-11AM If you hear ringing in the left ear, prepare yourself for a negative event. This could happen in your profession or personal life, but learn to handle negative situations and interpret them as a learning lesson. [14] X Research source If there’s ringing in the right ear, you can expect good fortune.

steps.title: 11AM-1PM
steps.content: 11AM-1PM Ringing in the left ear sometimes predicts you will receive a letter from a long-distance friend, partner, or family member. [15] X Research source Ringing in the right ear could mean a relative is about to visit you.

steps.title: 1PM-3PM
steps.content: 1PM-3PM If you hear ringing in the left ear, it usually indicates you will have an incredible party . Whether you’re the host or just a guest, mingle with everyone to have a fun time. [16] X Research source If you hear ringing in the right ear, it predicts a long-distance friend will visit you soon.

steps.title: 3PM-5PM
steps.content: 3PM-5PM Ringing in the left ear sometimes signals you are about to embark on a journey. If you choose go on a spiritual journey , be sure to write down all of your emotions. [17] X Research source If you hear ringing in the right ear, you can anticipate good luck.

steps.title: 5PM-7PM
steps.content: 5PM-7PM If you hear ringing in the left ear, you might lose money soon. Be sure to make small adjustments in your spending habits and spend strategically. [18] X Research source Right ear ringing usually means you can expect good luck and fortune.

steps.title: 7PM-9PM
steps.content: 7PM-9PM If your left ear is ringing, prepare yourself for a delicious feast. [19] X Research source If your right ear is ringing, you can expect a visit from a friend.

steps.title: 9PM-11PM
steps.content: 9PM-11PM If your left ear is ringing, it might be a positive sign of luck. [20] X Research source Many people believe right ear ringing predicts you will indulge in a feast.

steps.title: Repeated sneezes
steps.content: Repeated sneezes In many Asian cultures, random sneezing is a sign someone is thinking about you or they’re missing you. Generally, one sneeze means someone is thinking positively of you, while two sneezes means someone has negative thoughts about you. [21] X Research source In Polish culture, many people believe sneezing is a sign their mother-in-law is talking about them. If a couple isn’t married, it usually means they will have a terrible relationship with their in-laws. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Burning ears
steps.content: Burning ears The Irish believe a burning sensation in the ear signals someone is talking behind your back: if it’s the left ear, they’re saying nice things, but if it’s the right, they’re being spiteful. [23] X Research source Not sure who’s running their mouth? Pay close attention to their reaction when you walk into the room– read their body language and see if they start to behave differently around you.

steps.title: Random hiccups
steps.content: Random hiccups In India, an unexplainable hiccup attack is a sign that someone is thinking about you negatively. It’s often described as an extension of the evil eye, which attributes bad luck to an evil glance or thought from a jealous person. [24] X Research source To cure the evil eye , hang a six-sided mirror in a front window or the front door to reflect back bad energy, or contact a healer to perform a curing ritual.

steps.title: Tinnitus
steps.content: Tinnitus Tinnitus is usually described as ringing in the ear, and it’s a symptom of an underlying health condition, which can be caused by earwax blockages, exposure to loud noises, and blood vessel issues. [25] X Research source If you suspect you have tinnitus, see your primary care doctor to determine the best solution for you. To cope with tinnitus , listen to white noise or mask the ringing with a sound generator. If you have tinnitus, you may hear a variety of sounds: buzzing, clicking, hissing, ringing, roaring, and/or rushing. And, it can be low pitched, high pitched, soft or loud. [26] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Hearing loss
steps.content: Hearing loss There are tiny hairs in the inner ear that allow the brain to detect sound (cochlea hairs). When exposed to loud noises, these hair cells become permanently damaged, causing hearing loss. [27] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Some people have described hearing the “death” of the hair cell. It can occur with one loud sound exposure or repetitive exposures to the same frequency. [28] X Research source Tinnitus can occur as a result of hearing loss, but it doesn’t cause hearing loss itself. [29] X Research source

steps.title: High blood pressure
steps.content: High blood pressure High blood pressure, or hypertension, can affect the pressure of blood vessels in the ear, causing tinnitus (or making it worse). [30] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you hear a beating, pulsing, or pumping sound in the ear, it may be related to high blood pressure. [31] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source To treat tinnitus due to high blood pressure, physicians often recommend lifestyle changes like regular cardiovascular exercise , or they prescribe medication.
